thread.title: Curve drop 6th straight contest | Sports | tribdem.com
thread.title_full: Curve drop 6th straight contest | Sports | tribdem.com

author: The Tribune-Democrat
title: Curve drop 6th straight contest | Sports | tribdem.com
text: Po-Yu Chen tossed seven innings, allowing just one run on five hits with three strikeouts, but the Curve dropped their sixth consecutive game to Erie Thursday in 10 innings by a 5-4 margin at UPMC Park. It was the seventh consecutive start that lasted at least six innings for Chen, who has allowed one run or fewer in seven of his past 11 starts. Chen allowed an RBI single in the second inning before spinning off five scoreless innings to leave the game with a 3-1 lead. Luis Peralta tossed a scoreless eighth inning and recorded two outs in the ninth inning before Eliezer Alfonzo hit a game-tying, two-run home run to even the score at 3-all. He came back to strike out Ben Malgeri with the game-winning run on base to end the inning. Altoona plated its placed runner in the 10th on a Charles McAdoo RBI groundout, but Eddy Yean would allow a walk-off, two-run single to Gage Workman in the bottom of the frame to suffer the defeat. The Curve got their first three runs in the first six innings of the game. Sammy Siani put the Curve on the board in the first inning with a sacrifice fly before Brenden Dixon added to the score with an RBI single in the fourth. Jackson Glenn added an RBI single in the sixth. The Curve have now dropped each of their past six games since returning from the All-Star break. Altoona continues a six-game series with the Erie SeaWolves, Double-A affiliate of the Detroit Tigers, at 6:35 p.m. Friday. Right-hander Thomas Harrington is slated to start for the Curve with right-hander Jackson Jobe on the bump for the SeaWolves.
